revision.text:
{{Citation style|date=April 2013}} {{Cleanup-bare URLs|date=April 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Joe Lonsdale | image = | image_size = | caption = Lonsdale speaking at a TEDx event in LaJolla | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1982|9|12}}<ref name=born>[[NNDB]]</ref> | birth_place = [[Fremont, California]], [[US]] | nationality = {{flagicon|USA}} [[American people|American]] | occupation = * Managing partner in Formation8 * Chairman of [[Addepar]] | alma mater = [[Stanford University]] ([[Bachelor of Arts|B.A.]]) | networth = | known_for = | spouse = | children = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Joe Lonsdale''' (September 12, 1982) is an American entrepreneur, investor and philanthropist. He is a founder of [[Palantir Technologies]], a private company focused on analyzing, integrating and visualizing data especially in the global defense and finance space; Palantir was recently valued at over $4 billion.{{Citation needed|date=May 2013}} Prior to Palantir, Lonsdale was an early executive at [[Clarium Capital]]. He helped [[Peter Thiel]] grow the global macro fund to $5 Billion in [[assets under management]]. {{Citation needed|date=February 2012}} Lonsdale is also founder and Chairman at [[Addepar]], a private wealth management technology company.<ref name="Addepar Company Page">{{cite web|url=https://addepar.com/company |title=Addepar |publisher=Addepar |date= |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref> He invested out of Anduin Ventures and is now a Founder and [[General Partner]] at Formation8.<ref name="Anduin Ventures Team">http://anduinventures.com/#team.</ref><ref name="Crunchbase">[http://www.crunchbase.com/person/joe-lonsdale].</ref> He is also affiliated with [[Gunnar Optiks]] and Ostendo,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lonsdaleenterprises.com |title=Lonsdale Enterprises |publisher=Lonsdale Enterprises |date= |accessdate=2013-04-22}}{{Primary source-inline|date=April 2013}}</ref> personally invested in [[Ness Computing]] <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/ness-computing-announces-5m-series-a-financing-to-develop-personal-search-engine-125861333.html |title=Ness Computing Announces $5M Series A Financing to Develop Personal Search... - SILICON VALLEY, Calif., July 19, 2011 /PRNewswire/ |publisher=Prnewswire.com |date= |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref> and [[CapLinked]],<ref>{{cite web|author=Leena Rao |url=http://techcrunch.com/2011/02/22/the-paypal-mafia-puts-525k-in-caplinked-a-linkedin-meets-salesforce-for-private-investing |title=The PayPal Mafia Puts $525K In CapLinked, A LinkedIn-Meets-Salesforce For Private Investing |publisher=TechCrunch |date=2011-02-22 |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref> and worked with [[Lady Gaga]] to launch [http://www.thebackplane.com Backplane].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businessweek.com/magazine/content/11_25/b4233085780856.htm |title=From Hedge Funds to Lady Gaga |publisher=Businessweek |date=2011-06-09 |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref> He is also the chairman of Delphi Solutions, a company developing software for municipal governments.<ref>http://delphi.us/#team</ref>
==Personal Life and Education== Lonsdale grew up in [[Fremont, California]] and attended [[Mission San Jose High School]]. He graduated from [[Stanford University]] in 2003 with a degree in [[Computer Science]].
==Philanthropy== Lonsdale sits on the board of [[California Common Sense]],<ref>[http://www.cacs.org/cacs_team_member.php?id_tm=1 ]{{dead link|date=April 2013}}</ref> [[Strive for College]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.striveforcollege.org/about/directors.html |title=Board of Directors |publisher=Strive for College |date= |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref> [[Seasteading Institute|The Seasteading Institute]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Our team |publisher=[[The Seasteading Institute]] |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20111229184651/http://seasteading.org/about-seasteading/about-us/our-team |archivedate=2011-12-29 |url=http://seasteading.org/about-seasteading/about-us/our-team}}</ref> [[Lifeboat Foundation]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://lifeboat.com/ex/bios.joe.lonsdale |title=Lifeboat Foundation Bios: Joe Lonsdale |publisher=Lifeboat.com |date= |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref> Tonic<ref>http://www.tonic.com/about/board/bio/jon-lonsdale/</ref> and [[ONEHOPE|ONEHOPE Wine]]<ref>[http://onehopefoundation.org/our-team/ OneHope Foundation Team]</ref> a wine company devoted to donating a portion of their profits to charity.<ref>[http://www.onehopewine.com/about-us OneHope Wine: About]</ref> He was formerly on the board of the Social Profit Foundation.<ref>{{cite web|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20090502053326/http://www.socialprofitfoundation.org/board_of_directors.html |title=Social Profit Foundation |archivedate=2009-05-02 |url=http://www.socialprofitfoundation.org/board_of_directors.html }}</ref>
==Public Speaking== In 2011 Lonsdale participated in TEDxSilicon Valley.<ref>{{cite web|author=TEDxSV 2011 Talks Learning from Numbers Posted July 2011 |url=http://www.tedxsv.org/?page_id=1199 |title=TEDx Silicon Valley Â» Learning from Numbers |publisher=Tedxsv.org |date= |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref> Lonsdale gave a speech about "Learning from Numbers." In 2010 Lonsdale participated in TEDx La Jolla,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tedxlajolla.org/speakers/joe_lonsdale/ |title=September 21st, 2013 |publisher=Tedx La Jolla |date= |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref> giving a speech entitled "Man Machine Symbiosis." about [[intelligence amplification]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V-NS6l_Fg-0 |title=TEDxLaJolla - Joe Lonsdale - Man Machine Symbiosis |publisher=TEDxLaJolla |date=2010-11-03 |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref>
==Anduin Ventures== In 2010 Lonsdale founded Anduin Ventures.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.venturecapitalupdate.com/investor/02/27/joe-lonsdale.html |title=Joe Lonsdale |publisher=Venturecapitalupdate.com |date=2011-02-27 |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://anduinventures.com/ |title=Anduin Ventures |publisher=Anduin Ventures |date= |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref> Current investments include Practice Fusion, Infochimps,<ref>{{cite web|author=Nick Ducoff |url=http://blog.infochimps.com/2011/02/24/infochimps-expands-advisor-presence-coast-to-coast/ |title=Infochimps Expands Advisor Presence Coast to Coast | Infochimps Big Data Platform Blog |publisher=Blog.infochimps.com |date=2011-02-24 |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref> Ostendo, Addepar, Onramp, Apparel Media Group,<ref>{{cite web|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20110615070424/http://www.apparelmedia.com/about-us/investors/ |archivedate=2011-06-15 |title=Investors - Anduin Venture Partners |url=http://www.apparelmedia.com/about-us/investors/}}</ref> Kohort,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.xconomy.com/new-york/2011/04/19/kohort-raises-3-million-seed-round-for-social-media-startup/ |title=Kohort Raises $3 Million Seed Round for Social Media Startup |publisher=Xconomy |date=2011-04-19 |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref> Bump,<ref>http://blog.bump.com/post/4809194067/bump-com-grabs-1-2-million-series-b1</ref> Badgeville,<ref>http://badgeville.com/about</ref> Zanbato<ref>http://www.infrastructureinvestor.com/article.aspx?article=61310</ref> and ContextLogic.<ref>http://www.crunchbase.com/financial-organization/anduin-capital</ref>
==Formation 8== Lonsdale has recently launched a venture investment fund, Formation 8, in partnership with James Kim and Brian Koo. Current investments include Backplane,<ref>http://www.pehub.com/140830/formation8-raising-500m-vc-fund-filing/</ref> Revinate,<ref>http://blog.revinate.com/2012/07/revinate-receives-145-million-series-a-financing.html</ref> ContextLogic,<ref>http://formation8.com/</ref>/LearnSprout.<ref>http://techcrunch.com/2012/07/11/andreessen-learnsprout/</ref>and OculusVR.
==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}}
